properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 29 at 12:13PM AKST until March 1 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of
5 to 10 inches. Winds 20 to 30 mph with higher gusts to 45 mph
along the coast. Snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility to
one quarter mile or less at times in blowing snow. Lowest
visibilities in blowing snow are expected along the coast.

* WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM AKST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST SUNDAY
